column5: Greetings,In past years, I have used a ClineFinder to determine the depth of the thermocline in the water column. I was wondering if guys use their sonar units to determine the depth of the thermocline. If so, how do you go about establishing the various settings on your sonar unit to see the thermocline? I happen to be using a Humminbird Helix 9 unit at this time.Many sincere thanks....

Just keep your sensitivity adjustment available and crank up you sensitivity (more sensitivity) when you want a closer look. Should really be all that you need. I make the quick adjustment and then go back to original setting because I don't like looking at the thermocline and all the other junk all the time.
